item.title: Report E-2024070576
item.description:
Report E-2024070576

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately half a gallon (.5) due to a load shift that crushed one (1) 1-gallon metal pail. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel clean the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070516
item.description:
Report E-2024070516

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-24T15:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a small puncture in the body of the drum. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerize the recovered spent absorbents and the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight ’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070515
item.description:
Report E-2024070515

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-24T15:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: KENT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) liter of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic jerrycan due to a load shift during transit. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area, and the cleanup debris was containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum along with the damaged jerrycan. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070110
item.description:
Report E-2024070110

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: MARION
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 33ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released due to crushed freight due to hard braking damaging twelve (12) plastic bottles. First Call personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used a granular absorbent to gather the neutralized material. The spent absorbents were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged bottles were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was transported to the nearest ESTES terminal. The damaged bottles were then combined with the spent absorbents. The 55-gallon poly drum was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor’s demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
